New Records: Jasprit Bumrah was named Player of the Match.
Rohit Sharma retired hurt after being hit on the shoulder.
Rishabh Pant was whacked on the elbow, arm, chest, and glove.
Key Match Events: India won by eight wickets with 46 balls remaining
WICKET! India 91-2 (Suryakumar c Dockrell b White 2)
WICKET! Ireland 96 all out (White run out 3)
WICKET! Ireland 50-8 (McCarthy ct and b Axar 0)
WICKET! Ireland 49-7 (Adair c Dube b Hardik 3)
WICKET! Ireland 36-4 (Tector c Kohli b Bumrah 2)
WICKET! Ireland 7-1 (Stirling c Pant b Arshdeep 2)
Pre-Game Insights: India have left out Yashasvi Jaiswal, Kuldeep Yadav, Sanju Samson and Yuzvendra Chahal.
The pitch for the first game here, between Sri Lanka and South Africa, was unusual and awkward, so it would be unwise to make too many predictions.
At the age of 35 he has found another level as a T20 batter, which is a chilling thought for everyone else.
Post-Match Reflections: India captain Rohit Sharma’s reaction: I’m okay, just a little sore.
Ireland captain Paul Stirling’s reaction: It was tough. The toss played a pretty crucial part, with overcast conditions at the start, and the pitch offered a lot of movement.
The player of the match is Jasprit Bumrah, the happiest genius in the world
Miscellaneous Highlights: The ICC have a problem with this New York pitch, especially as India play Pakistan here on Sunday.
The pitch is fast becoming a problem for the ICC.
Have to do something about the pitches. Can't imagine India vs Pakistan on this one.
Others: Nasty pitch. Vastly more experienced, better batsmen than those who played for Ireland would have struggled on this strip.
Playing against that attack on that pitch would scramble most brains, and I’d ascribe the poor shots/decisions to that rather than irresponsibility.
